intro.description:
This cheat sheet will demonstrate how to create a feature for a plug-in using PDE.
To learn more about using cheat sheets, click the help button in the top right corner (?).

item.title: Open the plug-in development perspective
item.description:
To open the plug-in development perspective, select Window->Open Perspective->Other... and choose Plug-in Development.
Alternatively, click the following button to perform the task.

item.title: Create the feature
item.description: To create the feature, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Select "File->New->Project...", and choose "Feature Project" under the "Plug-in Development" heading
Input "com.example.feature" into the "Project Name" text box on the "Feature Properties" page
Input "Hello World! Feature" into the "Feature Name" text box and click "Next >"
Select the "com.example.helloworld" checkbox on the "Referenced Plug-ins and Fragments" page and click "Finish"

item.title: Add a feature description and license agreement
item.description:
The com.example.helloworld feature editor should be opened on the Overview page.
To add a feature description and license agreement, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Input "Hello, Eclipse world! feature description" into the "Text" dialog box
Select the "Copyright Notice" tab within the "Information" page
Select the "License Agreement" tab within the "Information" page
Input "Hello, Eclipse world! license agreement" into the "Text" dialog box
